intro: Pulsatilla australis, commonly known as the Australian pasqueflower, is a perennial herb native to Australia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has a short, hairy stem that supports its single, large flower with five petals. Its leaves are palmately divided, with three to five leaflets that are hairy and slightly lobed. Pulsatilla australis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed areas.
